title: Overweight people lost 35 to 52 pounds on newly approved diabetes drug, study says
description: A weekly dose of a medication recently approved by the US Food and Drug Administration to treat type 2 diabetes may help adults without diabetes lose weight as well, a new study found.

title: Nigerians grapple with escalating violence amid latest mass killing
description: A local lawmaker told CNN that "close to 50 people, including children" were killed when armed attackers opened fire during Mass at a Catholic church in Owo, Ondo State, Nigeria. CNN's David McKenzie reports.

title: US takes action against two private planes owned by Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich
description: A US judge approved the seizure of two of Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich's private planes, valued at more than $400 million, for violating US export and sanctions laws.

title: This landlocked county has been named Europe's best for bathing
description: The quality of Europe's bathing waters has improved dramatically in recent decades, and a new report released this week by the European Environment Agency (EEA) reveals that almost 85% of its bathing sites now rank as "excellent."

title: Former ABC News executive working with January 6 panel on upcoming hearings
description: The House Select Committee investigating the January 6 insurrection at the US Capitol is working with a former ABC News television executive to help with the planning for their upcoming hearings, according to a source familiar with the committee's plans.

title: LeBron James Triple Logoman trading card expected to set record at auction
description: A one-off LeBron James Triple Logoman trading card is going up for auction this week and could break a record for the most expensive sports card ever sold, according to Goldin Auctions.

title: Employees at Virgin Atlantic can now show off their tattoos
description: Tattooed crew members at British airline Virgin Atlantic are now welcome to show off their ink while in uniform.

title: Former ABC News executive working with January 6 panel on upcoming hearings
Kate Bush thanks 'Stranger Things' fans for boosting song
description: Kate Bush is happy about one of her old singles "being given a whole new lease of life."

title: 'They never missed Mass.' Woman loses both parents in Nigeria church attack that killed dozens
description: A woman who lost her parents in the southwestern Nigerian city of Owo said they regularly attended the Catholic church where a mass shooting killed dozens of people and left several injured on Sunday.

title: 10 US mass shootings over weekend leave at least a dozen dead and over 60 injured
description: Some of the victims were at a mall, a nightclub, a popular entertainment district or a high school graduation party.

title: The big city takeover of Texas barbecue
description: Once every four years, influential Texas Monthly magazine comes out with one of its most highly anticipated cover stories.

title: Uvalde student Eliahna Garcia would have turned 10 over the weekend. Instead, her family is holding her funeral today
description: Eliahna "Ellie" Garcia would have turned 10 over the weekend, but instead of getting ready to sing her "Happy Birthday," her family was preparing for her funeral.

title: The world's biggest four-day work week pilot begins
description: Thousands of UK workers are starting a four-day work week from Monday with no cut to their pay in the largest trial of its kind.

title: The ancient wonders found in the Arabian desert
description: The UAE may have only just celebrated its 50th anniversary of independence but Abu Dhabi has a centuries-old past.

title: Didi's stock jumps 50% on report that China's probe is ending
description: Didi's regulatory nightmare in China may be nearly over.

title: LinkedIn chief economist: Gen Z should be feeling great about the job market right now
description: Young workers who entered the US job market in the throes of the pandemic in 2020 faced an uphill battle. Hiring on LinkedIn dropped off dramatically, and widespread layoffs hit Gen Z more severely than most other groups.

title: Stocks are itching for a turnaround. This won't help
description: Late last week, Microsoft — the second largest public company in the United States — leveled with its investors. Earnings for the current quarter, it warned, would not be as strong as it had hoped.

title: Apple set to unveil new features for its most popular devices
description: Apple is set to kick off its annual developer conference on Monday where it will show off new features coming to its most popular devices. But Apple could also tease a new product long rumored to be in development.

title: The rule you don't know about that makes Marjorie Taylor Greene so powerful
description: CNN legal analyst Elliot Williams argues that an old governing principle in Congress is a big reason why there is so much dysfunction in politics and that cooking sausage is the perfect way to understand it.

title: How 'lab-grown' meat could help the planet and our health
description: What if there was a way to eat meat without farming and killing billions of animals per year, contributing to the climate crisis and risking high cholesterol levels?

title: Fashion highlights from Queen Elizabeth's Platinum Jubilee celebrations
First on CNN: Climate groups join for first-of-its-kind, $100 million push to mobilize midterm voters
description: In an attempt to mobilize voters around the climate crisis, six climate advocacy groups are readying for the midterms with an arsenal of $100 million -- the first coordinated spending of its kind.

title: China censored a top livestreamer. Now his fans are asking about the Tiananmen Square massacre
The Buffalo shooting suspect showed signs of violent behavior. Experts say troubled youth need long-term support
Here's the reason people tell me they want to buy an AR-15. And it's ludicrous
description: No weapon has been more in the public eye in America of late than the AR-15, in large part because of its tragic role in some of this country's deadliest shootings.

title: Prince Louis throws a tantrum during Queen Elizabeth's Platinum Jubilee pageant
description: Cameras catch Prince Louis acting out while watching a pageant on the final day of the Queen's Platinum Jubilee with his mother, Kate.

title: Even if Johnson survives this confidence vote, his premiership is far from safe
Priyanka Chopra blasts 'shameful' Indian body spray ad promoting rape culture
description: A television commercial for a male body spray has been taken off the air in India, after critics said it made light of gang rape.

title: Several Tampa Bay Rays players decline to wear LGBTQ logos on uniforms for Pride Night, reports say
description: Several players on the Tampa Bay Rays did not wear LGBTQ logos on their uniforms for the team's Pride Night celebration during Saturday's game against the Chicago White Sox.

title: Why the sparsely-populated South Pacific islands have become the next US-China contest
description: The island nations that stretch across the South Pacific -- sparsely populated atolls and volcanic archipelagos, known more for tourism than lucrative natural resources -- may not seem, at first glance, to be a major geopolitical prize.

title: Lionel Messi scores five goals in a single game to climb all-time international scoring list
description: Lionel Messi scored all five of Argentina's goals as it beat Estonia 5-0 in an international friendly on Sunday.

title: Even if Boris Johnson survives this confidence vote, his premiership is far from safe
description:
• Live: British PM faces vote of confidence
• Leadership shaken by 'Partygate' scandal

title: World's largest Buddhist temple to get more expensive
description: Visiting the world's largest Buddhist temple is about to get expensive.

title: South Korea, US launch eight missiles in response to North Korea
description: • Video: What N. Korea is learning from Russia

title: India's ruling party suspends official over comments about Islam
description: India's ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) said on Sunday it had suspended its spokeswoman Nupur Sharma in response to comments she made during a TV debate about the Prophet Mohammed.

title: Gunned down on a mercy mission: Witnesses say Russian troops killed Hostomel mayor and two volunteers
description: As Russian forces closed in on Hostomel in late February, the town's mayor Yurii Prylypko urged local residents to take care of each other.

title: He was attacked on January 6th. Hear his predictions about Trump
description: Michael Fanone, a former Capitol police officer who was attacked by rioters on January 6th, talks to CNN's Jim Acosta about what he expects will happen to former President Donald Trump after the January 6th committee presents all their evidence.

title: See how US and South Korea responded to North Korea's missile tests
description: South Korea and the United States responded to North Korea's launch of eight missiles by firing eight more missiles into waters off the east coast of the Korean peninsula. CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

title: 'Very dangerous': Chinese fighter jet 'chaffs' Australian plane, Canberra alleges
'Several active shooters' in Philadelphia area leave 3 people dead and 11 injured
description: At least three people were killed and 11 injured when multiple people opened fire in the busy South Street area of Philadelphia Saturday night, police said.
